titles: A new song of lulla by, or, Father Peter's policy discovered. A pritty babe, and hopeful son, of late we much did boast, but now, alas! we are undone, was ever Rome so crost. To the tune of, Green Sleeves. Or, My mistriss is to bulling gone.
notes: Verse: "In Rome there is a most fearful rout ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
